pr_title: chore: improve sr key schema check in insert values (MINOR)

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose of separately handling potential auth errors here rather than unifying in SchemaRegistryUtil where missing schemas are handled?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText:
It makes it a little easier to handle the error message. If it's an auth error, I want to expose that directly. If it's another error, then I want to throw our generic shim: "Could not determine that insert values..."
If I handled this in the SchemaRegistryUtil, then I would have to throw a different exception type or parse the exception message to decide whether to propagate it or to wrap it.
replies.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: Do we ever expect exceptions other than KsqlException here?
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: No, we shouldn't have any other exception type here. I'll consolidate it
replies.author: agavra

timeline.message: chore: improve sr key schema check in insert values (MINOR)
